section.title: Installing Red Hat Enterprise Linux Hosts
section.para: A Red Hat Enterprise Linux host, also known as a RHEL-based hypervisor is based on a standard basic installation of Red Hat Enterprise Linux on a physical server, with Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server and the Red Hat Virtualization entitlements enabled. For detailed installation instructions, see Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Installation Guide.
See for more information on how to enable the host hardware and software for device passthrough.

important.para: Virtualization must be enabled in your host's BIOS settings. For information on changing your host's BIOS settings, refer to your host's hardware documentation.
Third-party watchdogs should not be installed on Red Hat Enterprise Linux hosts, as they can interfere with the watchdog daemon provided by VDSM.
